metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15862 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Net-SNMP through 5.7.3 has Improper Privilege Management because SNMP WRITE access to the EXTEND MIB provides the ability to run arbitrary commands as root.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15862` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsnmp-base - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6
libsnmp-perl - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6
libsnmp30 - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6
python-netsnmp - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6
snmp - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6
snmpd - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6
snmptrapd - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6
tkmib - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6').
